main event: Two bright objects were observed passing overhead at Fort Belvoir, Virginia on December 16, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were pale blue-green in color and appeared to be traveling at a high rate of speed.
The objects turned the sky over, but not with enough intensity to obscure the stars.
The objects moved erratically, disappearing and reappearing, and moving closer and farther from the observers.
The movements of the objects were jerky and not over great distances.
The second object was visible until around 0535 when the daylight made it disappear.
sighted object: two bright, pale blue-green objects in the sky
witnesses: five members of the 515th Engineer Pipeline Company
